Posts.Content: IndigoMont11 wrote: I got the call at 2 p.m. today.  Gosh that waiting was unbelievable.  I actually finally stopped shaking and I feel SO much better.  Anyway, you can see below what it was, but a few more details: They found both IDC in the bigger tumor, and another smaller one, plus they also found DCIS.  The larger one is IDC "with lobular features".  I didn't do a lot of research into the hormone receptor stuff before, but the radiologist explained that to me today.  She also said that it does appear to be a slow growing cancer.  So it's been there a little while - but I'm fixing it now!! I go in for an MRI of both breasts and the lymph nodes 3/6 a.m., and then on 3/13 I meet with the surgeon - unless they call me back for something else they find from the MRI in the meantime.  So, I still haven't fully exhaled about the lymph node, but one step at a time. All I really know now is that I'll have surgery probably before the month is out or very early April. I broke the news via an e-mail blast to my coworkers, who I've worked with for so long (some of them 25 years!!) just so they'd get the word all at once, straight from me, and hopefully not have to feel too awkward about it.  The hardest thing for me with other people has always been knowing what to say to them, even when I wanted to offer support, so I was hoping to let them off the hook a bit.   This is progress.  I can breathe again.  I can sit still.  I can laugh and smile.  It stopped snowing here in Colorado and the sun is out.  Here's a huge hug to everyone as we head toward the weekend!  You are NOT alone here. Dx 3/2/2012, IDC, Left, 5cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 4/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 3/20/2012 Lymph node removal: Left, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right Chemotherapy 4/19/2012 AC Chemotherapy 7/11/2012 Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 10/14/2012 Breast, Lymph nodes Hormonal Therapy 12/12/2012 Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: The now official diagnosis IndigoMont11 Iz_and_Lys_Mum

Posts.Content: IndigoMont11 wrote: US guided core needle biopsy this morning.  After the mammo and US last Friday, the radiologist said there were not only two areas in my left breast that were suspicious, but also a spot on a lymph node that should probably be biopsied too.  But some good news - they looked a very long time not only at the left armpit but the right one too, and then he said he was definitely not convinced there was cause for concern.  I took a breath to say I wanted to be sure and could they just biopsy the lymph node anyway, but he said again, compared to everything else he could see about all the lymph nodes I had, there was not a reason to do so.  On the other hand, after he biopsied the two spots, I asked were we trying to see if this was cancer or were we trying to find out what kind of cancer, and he said, both.  The larger approx 3 cm mass was the most suspicious one and he said that it is probably cancer.   The procedure itself was so much better than the stereotactic biopsy I had a few years ago.  Not only was it quicker and more comfortable (on my back for maybe 20 minutes instead of on my front for over an hour, but the locals didn't hurt nearly as much, and I had very little bleeding.  With the other one I had a hard time getting the bleeding stopped.    I want everyone to know that I do feel so surrounded with everyone's strength, prayers, thoughts and well wishes.  There is so much power in that!  I am feeling so much better to cope with this than I would have if not for all the support.  Hugs to all!   You are NOT alone here. Dx 3/2/2012, IDC, Left, 5cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 4/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 3/20/2012 Lymph node removal: Left, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right Chemotherapy 4/19/2012 AC Chemotherapy 7/11/2012 Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 10/14/2012 Breast, Lymph nodes Hormonal Therapy 12/12/2012 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy done...now waiting ... IndigoMont11 IndigoMont11
